marginalization_types_with_short_descrip: Individuals & identities: undocumented immigrant from Guatemala living in the U.S.

privacy_tensions_with_short_description: Privacy vs. Disclosure of identity—sharing real identity online risks ICE detection
Privacy vs. Support—needs online mutual-aid groups for housing help

privacy_responses.description: Uses initials and avoids posting photos that reveal face or location.
Enters a false birth date on job-search sites to avoid matching to immigration databases.
Chats through end-to-end-encrypted apps and browses with Tor on public Wi-Fi.

costs_and_consequences: Labor-intensive identity management limits networking opportunities.
Potential legal repercussions if false data is discovered.
Encrypted traffic occasionally blocked by employers, hindering job search.

marginalization_types_with_short_descrip: Physical spaces & communities: lives in a conservative rural town

privacy_tensions_with_short_description: Privacy vs. Disclosure of identity—must hide queerness from local peers
Individual vs. Collective—risk of outing LGBTQ+ friends via mutual tags

privacy_responses.description: Runs three separate social-media accounts with non-overlapping audiences.
Strips EXIF data and uses auto-deleting encrypted messaging for support groups.

costs_and_consequences: Constant audience segmentation is emotionally taxing and time-consuming.
Accidental cross-posting could expose identity, causing social backlash.
Friends sometimes feel excluded, straining relationships.

marginalization_types_with_short_descrip: Physical spaces & communities: resident of subsidized senior housing
Marginalization in general: fixed low income

privacy_tensions_with_short_description: Privacy vs. Support—needs online health portals but fears scams

privacy_responses.description: Believes scams are inevitable and clicks unsolicited links out of frustration.
Refuses to create online banking account despite bank branch closure.

costs_and_consequences: Missed tele-health discounts and delayed benefit payments.
Relies on neighbors for online tasks, creating new dependency.

marginalization_types_with_short_descrip: Individuals & identities: Syrian refugee and political dissident
Online spaces: youth activist channels on encrypted platforms

privacy_tensions_with_short_description: Privacy vs. Autonomy—parental monitoring app required by guardian conflicts with activism secrecy

privacy_responses.description: Uses Signal with disappearing messages and disables camera geotagging.
Keeps activism phone hidden in a locked drawer at home.

costs_and_consequences: Loses device access if caught, hindering schoolwork.
May erase valuable historical evidence of abuse when messages auto-delete.

marginalization_types_with_short_descrip: Individuals & identities: Latina single mother engaging in sex work online
Online spaces: relies on niche subscription platforms for income

privacy_tensions_with_short_description: Privacy vs. Support—needs to promote content to earn but risks doxxing
Individual vs. Collective—child's privacy affected by her disclosures

privacy_responses.description: Uses stage name, virtual mailboxes, and watermarks to track reposts.
Sets household rules about never posting home photos.

costs_and_consequences: Maintaining multiple security services is expensive.
Potential loss of income when removing geotagged BTS content.
Emotional labor of constant vigilance leads to burnout.

marginalization_types_with_short_descrip: Physical spaces & communities: recent survivor in an intimate-partner-violence (IPV) shelter

privacy_tensions_with_short_description: Privacy vs. Support—needs phone tracking enabled for emergency aid
Privacy vs. Autonomy—shelter's mandatory device checks feel invasive

privacy_responses.description: Uses secure folder with fingerprint lock and emergency-wipe app.
Consults digital-safety advocates about stalkerware scans.
Shelter IT staff routinely wipe her phone backups to remove hidden trackers.

costs_and_consequences: Loses sentimental photos when backups are wiped.
Must trust shelter staff with sensitive data.
Abuser may retaliate if lock-out discovered.
